sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些连词均含有"因为"之意。
means: as ：从属连词，语意较because, since弱，着重在主句，所表示的原因或理由是"附带的"。
because ：从属连词，语意强，着重直接的原因或理由，所引出的从句是全句的重心，用以回答why提出的问题。
for ：并列连词，语气较弱，所引出的句子一般放在后面，表示附带说明的理由或推断理由。
since ：语意比because弱，但比as强，一般用于表示"由于大家已知的事实"。

because语气最强，回答why问句

entry.def: You use because when stating the reason for something.

example.ex: He is called Mitch, because his name is Mitchell...
example.tran: 人们叫他米奇，因为他大名叫米切尔。

example.ex: Because it is an area of outstanding natural beauty, you can't  build on it...
example.tran: 考虑到这一带自然风光旖旎，你不能建在这里。

entry.def: You use because when stating the explanation for a statement you have just made.

example.ex: Maybe they just didn't want to ask too many questions, because they rented us a room without even asking to see our papers...
example.tran: 也许他们只是懒得问太多的问题，因为他们都没要求看我们的证件就把一个房间租给我们了。

example.ex: The President has played a shrewd diplomatic game because from the outset he called for direct talks with the United States...
example.tran: 总统玩了一场高明的外交游戏，因为从一开始他就要求和美国直接对话。

entry.def: If an event or situation occurs because of something, that thing is the reason or cause.

example.ex: Many families break up because of a lack of money...
example.tran: 许多家庭由于缺钱而破裂。

example.ex: Because of the law in Ireland, we had to work out a way of getting her over to Britain.
example.tran: 由于爱尔兰的法律所限，我们不得不想办法把她弄到英国去。

entry.def: You use just because when you want to say that a particular situation should not necessarily make you come to a particular conclusion.

example.ex: Just because it has a good tune does not mean it is great music...
example.tran: 仅凭旋律优美并不见得就是一首杰出的音乐作品。

example.ex: Just because something has always been done a certain way does not make it right.
example.tran: 仅仅因为老是以某种方式做事并不意味着这么做就是对的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from the phrase by cause, influenced by Old French par cause de 'by reason of'
